text: “At that time,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 31:1 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“I will be the God of all the clans\f + \fr 31:1 \ft Or “families” \f* of Israel,
and they will be to me a people.”
Thus says Yahweh:
“\add The\add* people of \add the\add* survivors of the sword found grace in the desert;\f + \fr 31:2 \ft Or “wilderness” \f*
Israel going to find their rest.”
From afar Yahweh appeared to me, \add saying\add*,
“I have loved you \add with\add* an everlasting love.
⸤Therefore⸥\f + \fr 31:3 \ft Literally “Unto thus” \f* I have drawn you \add with\add* loyal love.
I will again build you,
and you will be built, O virgin Israel.
You will again adorn yourself \add with\add* your tambourines,
and you will go forth in \add the\add* dancing in a ring of \add the\add* merrymakers.
You will again plant vineyards on the mountains of Samaria.
\add The\add* planters will plant, and they will enjoy \add it\add*.\f + \fr 31:5 \ft Here the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation \f*
For there will be a day \add when\add* watchmen will call in the hill country of Ephraim,
‘Stand up, and let us go up \add to\add* Zion, to Yahweh our God.’ ”
For thus says Yahweh,
“Sing for joy for Jacob \add with\add* gladness,
and shout out for the head of the nations.
Proclaim, praise, and say,
‘Save, \add O\add* Yahweh, your people, the remnant of Israel.’
Look, I \add am\add* going to bring them from \add the\add* land of \add the\add* north,
and I will gather them from \add the\add* remotest part of \add the\add* earth.
Among them \add the\add* blind, and \add the\add* lame,
\add those who are\add* pregnant, and \add those who\add* give birth,
together, a great assembly,
they will return here.
With weeping they will come,
and with pleas for mercy I will bring them;
I will let them walk by streams of water in a straight path.
They will not stumble in it,
for I have become to Israel a father,
and Ephraim, he \add is\add* my firstborn.”
Hear the word of Yahweh, \add O\add* nations,
and declare in the coastlands from afar, and say,
“The scatterer of Israel will gather him,
and he will keep him as a shepherd his flock.
For Yahweh has ransomed Jacob,
and he has redeemed him from \add the\add* hand of \add the\add* person ⸤stronger⸥\f + \fr 31:11 \ft Literally “strong” \f* than he.
And they will come,
and they will sing for joy on the height of Zion,
and they will be radiant over the goodness of Yahweh,
over \add the\add* grain, and over \add the\add* wine, and over \add the\add* olive oil,
and over \add the\add* young ones of \add the\add* flock, and over \add the\add* cattle.
And their life will become like a well-watered garden,
and they will never languish again.”
“Then \add the\add* young woman will rejoice in \add the\add* dancing in a ring,
and \add the\add* young men and \add the\add* old men together.
And I will turn their mourning to jubilation,
and I will comfort them,
and I will gladden them from their sorrow.
And I will saturate the appetite of the priests \add with\add* fatness,
and my people will be satisfied with my goodness,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 31:14 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
Thus says Yahweh,
“A voice \add is\add* heard in Ramah,
lamentation, \add the\add* weeping of bitterness.
Rachel \add is\add* weeping for her children;
she refuses to be comforted because of her children,
for they are no \add more\add*.”
Thus says Yahweh:
“Restrain your voice from weeping,
and your eyes from tears,
for there is a reward for your work,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 31:16 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“and they will return from \add the\add* land of \add the\add* enemy.
And there is hope for your future,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 31:17 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“and \add your\add* children will return to their territory.
Indeed I heard Ephraim pitying themselves,
‘You disciplined me, and I was disciplined,
like a calf that is not trained.
Bring me back and let me return,
for you \add are\add* Yahweh my God.
For after my turning back I repented,
and after coming to understand I struck \add my\add* thigh.
I was ashamed and also humiliated,
because I bore the disgrace of my youth.’
\add Is\add* Ephraim my dear son,
or \add the\add* child of \add my\add* delight?
For ⸤as often as⸥\f + \fr 31:20 \ft Literally “from enough” \f* I have earnestly spoken against him,
I still remember him.
⸤Therefore⸥\f + \fr 31:20 \ft Literally “Unto thus” \f* my bowels are turbulent for him,
surely I will have compassion on him,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 31:20 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
“Set up for yourself road markers,
make for yourself signposts,
set your ⸤mind⸥\f + \fr 31:21 \ft Literally “heart” \f* to the main road,
\add the\add* road \add by which\add* you went.
Return, O virgin of Israel,
return to these your cities.
⸤How long⸥\f + \fr 31:22 \ft Literally “Until when” \f* will you waver, O unfaithful daughter?
For Yahweh has created a new \add thing\add* on the earth,
a woman, she shelters a man.”

Thus says Yahweh of hosts, the God of Israel, “They will again say these words\f + \fr 31:23 \ft Hebrew “word” \f* in the land of Judah and in its towns at my restoring their fortunes,\f + \fr 31:23 \ft Hebrew “fortune” \f*
‘Yahweh bless you, \add O\add* settlement of righteousness,
O hill of holiness.’
And Judah and all of its towns together will live in it,
farmers and those who travel with the flocks.\f + \fr 31:24 \ft Hebrew “flock” \f*
For I will saturate \add the\add* thirst of \add the\add* weary,
and every person \add who\add* languishes I will replenish.”
At this I awoke and looked,
and my sleep was pleasant to me.
The New Covenant

“Look, \add the\add* days \add are\add* coming,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 31:27 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh, “and I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah \add with the\add* seed of humankind, and \add with the\add* seed of animals.\f + \fr 31:27 \ft Hebrew “animal” \f*

⸤And then⸥\f + \fr 31:28 \ft Literally “And it will happen” \f* as I have watched over them to pull up, and to tear down, and to annihilate, and to destroy, and to do evil, so I will watch over them to build and to plant,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 31:28 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.

“In those days they will say no longer, ‘⸤Parents⸥\f + \fr 31:29 \ft Literally “Fathers” \f* have eaten unripe fruit, and \add the\add* teeth of \add the\add* children ⸤are set on edge⸥\f + \fr 31:29 \ft Literally “have become blunt” \f*.’

⸤But⸥\f + \fr 31:30 \ft Literally “But if” \f* each will die because of his iniquity, ⸤everyone⸥\f + \fr 31:30 \ft Literally “all of the humankind” \f* who eats the unripe fruit, their teeth will ⸤be set on edge⸥.\f + \fr 31:30 \ft Literally “become blunt” \f*

Look, \add the\add* days \add are\add* coming,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 31:31 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh, “and I will ⸤make⸥\f + \fr 31:31 \ft Literally “cut” \f* a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah,

not like the covenant that I ⸤made⸥\f + \fr 31:32 \ft Literally “cut” \f* with their ancestors\f + \fr 31:32 \ft Or “fathers” \f* on the day of my grasping \add them\add*\f + \fr 31:32 \ft Here the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation \f* by their hand, bringing them out from the land of Egypt, my covenant that they themselves broke, though I myself was a master over them,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 31:32 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.

“But this \add is\add* the covenant that I will ⸤make⸥\f + \fr 31:33 \ft Literally “cut” \f* with the house of Israel after those days,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 31:33 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh: “I will put my law in their inward parts and on their hearts\f + \fr 31:33 \ft Hebrew “heart” \f* I will write it, and I will be to them God, and they themselves will be to me people.

And they will no longer teach each one his neighbor, or each one his brother, ⸤saying⸥,\f + \fr 31:34 \ft Literally “to say” \f* ‘Know Yahweh,’ for all of them will know me, from their ⸤smallest⸥\f + \fr 31:34 \ft Literally “small” \f* and up to their ⸤greatest⸥,”\f + \fr 31:34 \ft Literally “great” \f* ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 31:34 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh, “for I will forgive their iniquity and their sin I will no longer remember.”

Thus says Yahweh, who gives \add the\add* sun for light by day, the regulations of \add the\add* moon and \add the\add* stars for light \add by\add* night, who stirs up the sea and its waves roar—Yahweh of hosts \add is\add* his name.

“If these rules would cease from ⸤before me⸥,”\f + \fr 31:36 \ft Literally “to the face of me” \f* ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 31:36 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh, “also the offspring of Israel would cease from being a nation ⸤before me⸥\f + \fr 31:36 \ft Literally “to the face of me” \f* ⸤forever⸥.”\f + \fr 31:36 \ft Literally “all the days” \f*

Thus says Yahweh, “If \add the\add* heavens above can be measured, and \add the\add* foundations of \add the\add* earth below can be explored, also I will reject all the offspring of Israel because of all that they have done,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 31:37 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.

“Look, days \add are\add* coming,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 31:38 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh, “and the city will be rebuilt for Yahweh, from the Tower of Hananel \add to\add* the Corner Gate.

And ⸤the measuring line⸥\f + \fr 31:39 \ft Literally “the string of the measurement” \f* will still go out immediately in front \add of\add* it to the hill of Gareb, and it will turn \add to\add* Goah.

And the whole of the valley \add of\add* the corpses, and the ashes, and all the cultivated fields up to the wadi of Kidron, up to the corner of the Gate of the Horses \add toward the\add* east \add will be\add* holy to Yahweh. It will not be uprooted, and it will not be overthrown again ⸤forever⸥.”\f + \fr 31:40 \ft Literally “to eternity” \f*
